content: cont in pattern no decreases rs k1 ssk cont in pattern 6 sts have been decreased complete 4 more row in pattern with no decreases bind off 41 sts on ws row leave a long enough tail to sew up the shoulders at the end ~20 in/ 51 cm left shoulder as worn attach new yarn ws p1 ssk cont in pattern rs cont in pattern until 6 sts left slip 2 sts onto cable needle and hold at back k1 from left needle k2 from cable needle k2tog k1 ws p1 p2tog cont in pattern rs cont in pattern until 3 sts k2tog k1 ws cont in pattern no decreases rs cont in pattern until 3 sts k2tog k1 ws cont in pattern no decreases rs cont in pattern until 3 sts k2tog k1 6 sts have been decreases complete 4 more row in pattern with no decreases bind off 41 sts on ws row leave a long enough tail to sew up the shoulders at the end ~20 in/ 51 cm *if you changed length of panel the chart may line up differently at neckline and the cable maneuver on row 2 may not be needed back body follow exact instruction from front body using chart a these 2 panels are the same for the first 133 row in pattern 143 row including bottom stockinette/ribbing portion do not complete the neckline section for this panel posted for free only on ravelry ©copyright gia giaetcetra 2025 4 instead follow chart a with 24 sts of moss stitch on either end of panel until 146 row 156 row including bottom stockinette/ribbing portion bind off on rs row row 4 on chart a sleeves make 2 the same cast on 55 stitches on us 7 4 5mm needles complete 13 row of 1x1 rib end on ws the first and last stitch for the entire panel is stockinette k on rs p on ws because it will be mattress stitched at the end on next rs row increase 18 stitches evenly kfb approx every 3 stitches place 18 removable stitch markers evenly throughout before starting the row and kfb where they are placed there are now 73 sts switch to us 9 5 5mm starting on ws chart c will now be followed i put stitch markers in between the following sections 14 sts moss stitch 10 sts cable pattern 25 sts diamond pattern 10 sts cable pattern 14 sts moss pattern *if you make moss section bigger or smaller the section must be started with an even number mine is 14 in order to maintain moss pattern during kfb increases make kfb increases on marked row rs kfb into first stitch k next stitch cont in pattern till 2 sts left kfb k last stitch ws p2 cont in pattern till 2 sts left p2 *note kfb increases can only be worked every 2 6 10 14 row etc in order to maintain moss stitch pattern they must be worked
